plugins.name: Frames to Pages
plugins.description:
‚ú® About the Plugin


Organize your Figma files more efficiently!


This plugin moves each selected frame into its own new page automatically, helping you:


  1. Improve performance on heavy files.
  2. Make navigation faster and more intuitive.
  3. Keep versions and project sections clearly separated.


Perfect for large projects, collaborative teams, and anyone who values a clean and structured workspace.


üí° Why use this plugin?


As Figma projects grow, pages often become crowded with dozens (or hundreds) of frames.

This can cause:


  1. Slower loading times.
  2. Harder navigation and confusion for new collaborators.
  3. Increased risk of overwriting or losing important work.


By splitting frames into separate pages, your file becomes lighter, faster, and easier to maintain.


üìö Common Use Cases


  1. Large projects: Quickly organize dozens of screens into individual pages.


  1. Version management: Save different design versions separately without cluttering a single page.


  1. Developer handoff: Share organized sections with developers more easily.


  1. Team collaboration: Help new team members find what they need faster.


üõ†Ô∏è How it works


  1. Select the frames you want to organize.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Choose whether to delete the original page or keep it.


Each selected frame will be placed into a brand new page, keeping its content intact.
plugins.tagline: Move each selected frame into its own new page automatically. Organize your Figma files easily.

plugins.name: Badenova Design System Sync
plugins.description:
This plugin synchronizes your Figma tokens with the Badenova Design System


Usage:

You need to provide a valid GitHub token to synchronize your Figma tokens.

To obtain a GitHub token, contact christoph.hummel@badenova.de or generate your own token.


If you have a valid GitHub token, enter it into the respective input field and press Save.

Then, click the Sync Badenova Design-Tokens button.

If the synchronization is successful, you will receive a confirmation message.
plugins.tagline: Synchronize your Figma tokens with the Badenova Design System

plugins.name: LARA for Figma
plugins.description:
LARA is the flagship product of Lithero, the first AI company to design and build products specifically for pharma marketing teams. LARA is a custom-made AI that learns the nuances of pharma brands at lightspeed, supporting brand teams throughout the end-to-end content creation process.


The official LARA for Figma plugin brings the power of LARA Screen and LARA Claims to your workspace. Get actionable feedback on the compliance of your content at the point of creation, saving significant time downstream. LARA for Figma complements the content creation process by ensuring high quality and accuracy of created content. Shorten review cycles, reduce spend, and get the most out of Figma with LARA!


Key Features:

Claims

- Detect differences between created content and approved claims, enabling corrections before MLR

- Trace claims back to their references and associated safety text in LARA Claims for additional context


Safety Text

- Identify and insert any required safety text missing from the content

- Generate accurate & complete safety text blocks to insert into content


References

- Find potential approved references that could be used to substantiate claims

- Locate any claims that are missing citations to typically seen references


*Requires subscription to LARA Claims and Screen. For more information, visit https://www.lithero.com/
plugins.tagline: Bring the power of LARA to your process

plugins.name: Component repeater
plugins.description:
# Component Repeater


A Figma plugin that helps you create components from repeated elements while preserving variations in styles, text, and images.


## What it does


This plugin analyzes your selection and creates a component that intelligently handles:


- Style variations (colors, effects, layout properties)

- Text content variations

- Image variations


When you have multiple similar elements that differ in styles or content, this plugin will:


1. Create a main component with variants for different styles

2. Create a separate component set for image variations

3. Replace all selected elements with instances of the component

4. Preserve the original text content and image placement


## How to use it


1. **Select similar elements**


- Select two or more groups or frames that have the same structure

- The plugin has a feature to help you find all similar elements from one selected node

- The elements can have different styles, text content, or images but should have the same layer structure


2. **Run the plugin**


- The plugin will analyze your selection and show variations in:

- Text content

- Colors and effects

- Images

- Layout properties


3. **Create the component**


- Click "Replace selection with a component"

- The plugin will create:

- A main component with style variants (if variations exist)

- A separate image component set (if images are used)

- Instances that preserve the original variations


4. **Finding similar elements**

- Select a single element

- Click "Find Similar Nodes" to select all elements with the same structure

- Use this to find more elements to include for replacement


## Tips


- The plugin works best with elements that have the same structure (same hierarchy of layers)

- Style variations are automatically detected and turned into variants

- Text content is preserved in each instance

- Images are turned into a swappable component

- Use the resize handle in the bottom right to adjust the plugin window size


## Requirements


- Works with groups and frames

- Selected elements must have the same layer structure

- Supports both direct images and image fills
plugins.tagline: Create components from repeated elements while preserving variations in styles, text, and images

plugins.name: The Ultimate Table
plugins.description:
The Ultimate Table is a powerful Figma plugin that enables you to create reusable, fully customizable tables with draggable rows and columns.


Features

  1. Rearrange, remove, add, or duplicate columns and rows
  2. Drag to adjust column widths in header cells
  3. Automatic row height adjustment based on content
  4. Maintain linked tables across your design


Styling Options

  1. Customizable padding, margins, and borders
  2. Column text alignment controls
  3. Zebra striping support
  4. Header styling with sort/filter/search indicators
  5. Custom border radius
  6. Flexible font and size options


Smart Updates

  1. Master table controls for consistent styling


Need a quick start?

  1. Learn all there is to know in less than 10 minutes in this video tutorial
  2. Complete tutorial (Written & Video) at ultimate-table.com
plugins.tagline: Finally a plugin to create reusable, fully customizable tables with draggable rows and columns.

plugins.name: Components to Section
plugins.description:
Easily regroup all your master components into a section. Runs across all pages of your file

Plugin does not have UI to run.


How to use

Launch via cmd + / or go to plugin > Component to Section

Tab and choose

  1. Run on current page
  2. Run on all pages
  3. Set preferences


Preferences (User saved)

  1. Choose where to create the section (current page or new page)
  2. Choose the spacing between regrouped components


Why paid?

I'm a hobbyist and it's very difficult to write clean efficient code.

I have a day job and it's a good way to keep me motivated and work extra hours.

$2 is the cheapest a plugin can be sold on figma, I was happy with $0.99 but hey...


If this plugin starts selling regularly I will keep adding commands to make it even more powerful


Free stuff

If you are looking for free stuff, I have published two widget and they are currently used by more than 50K users


Help out ?

I'm in the London, UK and always keen to hear about fellow hackers, If you want to contribute to the plugin or have a suggestion feel free to contact me on edwardbattistini.com/contact

accepted.name: EdwardB
accepted.description: Product designer during the day. Super dad at night

Introduction

This plugin allows users to quickly create Figma elements by inputting JSON data, improving workflow efficiency.


Function Description

  1. Generate Figma elements through JSON input
  2. Multi-language user interface support
  3. Compatible with multi-layered frame structures
  4. Can be used together with the plugin Export Frame JSON Pro for seamless frame export and import.


How to Use

  1. Open the plugin interface and select the appropriate language.
  2. Enter or paste valid JSON data into the JSON input field.
  3. Click the ‚ÄúSubmit JSON‚Äù button, and the plugin will generate corresponding Figma elements based on the input data.


Important Notes

  1. Ensure the JSON data is correctly formatted, or elements may not be generated properly.
  2. This plugin can be used together with Export Frame JSON Pro for quick frame import and export.

  2. Multi-language user interface support

plugins.description:
Introduction

Path Text Aligner is a Figma plugin that allows users to easily align text along any custom path, providing more flexibility and control over text placement in your design.


Function Description

  1. Aligns selected text to any vector path or shape.
  2. Adjusts text along curves, straight lines, and complex paths.
  3. Offers controls for offset and spacing to fine-tune text positioning.
  4. Supports multi-line text alignment along a path.


How to Use

  1. Select the text you want to align.
  2. Draw or select the path you want the text to follow.
  3. Run the plugin, and the text will automatically align to the path.
  4. Adjust settings for text spacing, direction, and offset to achieve the desired effect.


Notes

  1. This plugin works best with vector paths (e.g., lines or shapes).
  2. Ensure the text layer is not grouped with other objects for proper alignment.
  3. You may need to adjust font size or path curvature for optimal results.

plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin automates the numbering of selected Figma artboards, allowing you to customize the naming sequence with prefixes and suffixes. It supports multiple languages, enhancing your workflow efficiency and organization.


Function Introduction

  1. Automatically numbers selected artboards in Figma.
  2. Customizable naming with prefixes and suffixes.
  3. Supports multiple languages.
  4. Two naming sequences: left-to-right then top-to-bottom, or top-to-bottom then left-to-right.


How to Use

  1. Select the artboards you want to rename.
  2. Choose your preferred naming sequence.
  3. Optionally, add a prefix or suffix.
  4. Click "Apply Naming" to rename the selected artboards.


Notes

  1. Ensure artboards are selected before applying the naming operation.
  2. The plugin temporarily disables the apply button for 2 seconds to prevent accidental multiple clicks.

plugins.name: Layer Query
plugins.description:
A powerful layer selection plugin that lets you find and select layers based on their design properties and custom component properties. Perfect for managing large design files and design systems efficiently.


## Key Features


- Multi-property search with combination filters

- Custom component property support (boolean, text, variant, instance swap)

- Flexible search scope: Entire file, Current page, Root frame, or Selected frames

- Search results with page grouping and navigation

- Real-time search progress with cancellation support

- Cross-page layer selection and navigation


## Supported Properties


**Typography:** Font size, font family, line height, text alignment, text content

**Fill:** Fill color, opacity

**Size:** Width, height

**Padding:** All directions (top, bottom, left, right, vertical, horizontal)

**Auto Layout:** Direction, sizing, alignment, item spacing

**Stroke:** Stroke color, stroke width

**Corner Radius:** All corners and individual corner values

**Layer:** Layer name, structure, type, opacity

**Position:** X and Y coordinates

**Custom:** Component instance properties


## Perfect For


- Design system maintenance and auditing

- Finding layers with specific styling across large files

- Quality assurance and design consistency checks

- Efficient layer organization and cleanup

- Component property management


Save hours of manual searching with precise property-based queries. Transform your Figma workflow from manual hunting to smart selection.


## Beta Version


This plugin is currently in beta. Please report any issues or feedback to help improve the experience.
plugins.tagline: Query and select layers by properties including custom components. Advanced search for efficiency.

plugins.name: Tiny Exports
plugins.description:
Optimize your exported assets for web and mobile applications with just a few clicks.


Features

  1. Export layers with Figma‚Äôs export settings
  2. Support for layer naming conventions. Useful for setting exports in component libraries.
  3. Export individual layers or all at once
  4. Export only exportable layers under the current selection
  5. Support for TinyPNG compression (API key required) ‚Äì available for free
  6. WIP: Apply export settings automatically to all image layers
  7. WIP: Apply export settings to all manually selected layers


How to Use

  1. Set Figma‚Äôs export settings or use the naming convention `export-[scale]x-[format]` (e.g., `export-1.5x-png`).
  2. Trigger the plugin in Figma while in design mode.
  3. Get a TinyPNG API key from [tinypng.com/developers](https://tinypng.com/developers) and enter it in the plugin‚Äôs Settings tab.
  4. Enable TinyPNG compression for optimized images.
  5. Use the plugin UI to export individual layers or all at once.


Naming Convention

SVGs or PDFs do not support `scale`. If a naming convention is present, it is preferred over Figma's export settings. It is recommended to use Figma's export settings if you can.

  1. Format: `export-[scale]x-[format]`
  2. `scale`: Any number (e.g., 2, 1.5) ‚Äì 1 by default
  3. `format`: png, jpg, svg, or pdf ‚Äì jpg is set by default


Examples:

  1. `imageName [export-1.5x-png]`
  2. `imageName [export-2x-jpg]`
  3. `imageName [export-jpg]`
  4. `svgName [export-svg]`


Security

  1. The TinyPNG API key is stored only locally
  2. The plugin uses a proxy to communicate with the API


Known Issues

- Unable to export and set multiple exports from one layer
plugins.tagline: Easily export all layers with TinyPNG compression.
